2370415430586059806-Maze.title: noun - This word appears on a link on another page to direct users to this maze tutorial.
3799760460110153809-Maze.level: noun - This refers to the level in a game and will be followed by a number, as in 'Level 1' (the beginning level) or 'Level 10' (the final level).
3542684864087093156-Maze.instructions1: instructions - the word 'program' refers to a computer program, and thewords for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified.  If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.
3107464560858837706-Maze.instructions2: instructions - the word 'steps' refers to instructions in a computer program; 'path' refers to the path through a maze.  See previous description for tense.
4117834464422802314-Maze.instructions3: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.
7924052971858977034-Maze.instructions4: instructions - the goal is reaching the end point in a maze; 'block' refers to a child's building block.
5504218682327601531-Maze.instructions5: instructions - 'turn left' refers to rotating in place a quarter circle counter-clockwise.
7837544939813721855-Maze.instructions6: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.
4142991828936593951-Maze.instructions7: instructions displayed along with a new maze for the user to solve.
8369157115089930453-Maze.instructions8: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block.
7801554455370029732-Maze.instructions9: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block.  For 'if-else' concatenate the words for 'if' and 'else/otherwise'.
4572857545803877392-Maze.instructions10: instructions - This advises the user to solve a maze by keeping his/her left hand in contact with the wall while proceding through it.  The final sentence is a warning that only advanced programmers should attempt this problem, as beginners tend to get frustrated.
5729392237036335843-Maze.codeTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.
2194902007208446636-Maze.linkTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the user's program to be saved and for a URL to be provided for retrieving it.  The word 'blocks' is as in children's toy blocks.
3405095074586122676-Maze.randomizeToolti: tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the start marker and finish markers in the current maze to be moved to random locations, without othwerise changing the maze.
3882730113723469795-runProgram: button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.
3187612389707401187-Maze.runProgram: button label - Pressing the button causes Pegman return to the start of the maze (but does not delete the user's program.)
4138774728570944645-Maze.moveForward: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking) in the direction he is facing. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move backward'.
1358173597489516917-Maze.move: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking). The word for 'forward' or 'backward' will be attached to it later.
1529911836220306505-Maze.forward: adverb - to modify the word for 'move', describing an individual person's movement.
5922058615793206650-Maze.backward: adverb - to modify the word for 'move', describing an individual person's movement.
5575726721959732086-Maze.turn: verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body to face a different direction.  The modifier 'right', 'left', or 'randomly' will be attached to it later.
1848910458363630250-Maze.left: adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', describing an individual person's change in direction of 90 degrees clockwise.
7793250186887899403-Maze.right: adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', describing an individual person's change in direction of 90 degrees counter-clockwise.
7768928174475133866-Maze.randomly: adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', indicating that whether a person turns left or right is being left to chance.
7927161468797296036-Maze.path: noun - a path through a maze, to be modified later by a direction, as in 'is there a path ahead'.
6675633699200081385-Maze.ifPath: noun - describing one or more commands that will be executed if some condition is true.  This can also be translated as 'true path'.
1007522636784730457-Maze.ifDo: verb - imperative or infinitive preceding one or more commands to a person.
7089180101548436436-Maze.ifElse: conjunction - 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.
3812681848699619019-Maze.ahead: adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.
3570353873001116034-Maze.toTheLeft: adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path to the left, move backward'.
1713718763430653774-Maze.toTheRight: adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path to the right, end game'.
1040240593669985332-Maze.behind: adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path behind, move backward'.
3760279214088835030-Maze.repeatUntilFini: verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands until the program is finished (the end of a maze has been reached).
8778412585302442086-Maze.getX: verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the horizontal coordinate of a point in a two-dimensional plane (e.g., how far to the right (east) a player is.)
5896611286146483382-Maze.getY: verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the vertical coordinate of a point in a two-dimensional plane (e.g., how far down (south) a player is.)
5901977129646228588-Maze.getDirection: verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the direction (north, south, east, or west) a player is facing.
4473599517336461413-Maze.moveForwardTool: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).  The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
297931026100856843-Maze.moveTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
826514418572436974-Maze.turnTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
412027119640112732-Maze.ifTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
6175401358049603739-Maze.ifelseTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
1190064103412776740-Maze.whileTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
2851408625944702724-Maze.isPathTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
2110603084480821434-Maze.getXTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
1058207181145807400-Maze.getYTooltip: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
4305273814764452265-Maze.getDirectionToo: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps.  See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
2581575470485534053-Maze.capacity0: warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed.
2296845725372160378-Maze.capacity1: warning - Only one more block may be added.
3087414586097524310-Maze.capacity2: warning - Only %1 more blocks may be used, where %1 is an integer greater than 1.
7358214333593766572-Maze.nextLevel: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the maze, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty.  %1 is an integer greater than 1.
7149849676690329496-Maze.finalLevel: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.
4051416073809352347-Maze.oneTopBlock: alert - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.
